<p style="margin-top: 0cm; margin-right: 0cm; margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The
proposal would result in the additional dwellinghouse being sited on garden
land. As such, the principle of the development is contrary to the Harrow Core
Strategy of directing new residential and other development to the Harrow and
Wealdstone Opportunity Area, town centres and, in suburban areas, to strategic
previously developed sites and would therefore harm its implementation,
contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies CS1.A and
CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and the adopted Supplementary Planning
Document: Garden Land Development (2013).<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>

<p>The proposed dwelling by reason of its inadequate floor to ceiling height, would result in a substandard of living accommodation&nbsp; failing to provide a fit for purpose residential unit of an appropriate design, quality and layout for the potential future occupiers, contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies D3.D(7) and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies DM1 and DM 26 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013), the Technical Housing Standards Nationally Described Space Standards (2015), the Mayor of London Supplementary Planning Guidance (2016), and the adopted Residential Design Guide Supplementary Planning Document (2010).<br></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 0cm; margin-right: 0cm; margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The
proposed two storey side extension, by reason of its excessive width would give
rise to a disproportionate addition which would fail to respect the proportions
and subsume the host dwelling, it would also fail to provide a coherent pattern
of development in the street scene thus would substantially harm the form,
openness and proportion of the site, relationship with the properties in the
locality accentuated by its prominent siting to the detriment of the character
and appearance of the streetscene and the pattern of development within the
surrounding area and would therefore be contrary to the high quality design
aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies D3.D(1)
and D3.D(11) of The London Plan (2021), Policy CS.1B of the Harrow Core
Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Development Management Plan Local Policies
(2013) and the Adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design
Guide (2010).<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>

<p style="margin-top: 0cm; margin-right: 0cm; margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;"><span lang="EN-US" style="">The applicant </span>h<span lang="EN-US" style="">as failed to submit a satisfactory Flood Risk Assessment and has therefore failed to
demonstrate that the proposed development would not exacerbate the risk of
flooding within the site or increase the risk and consequences of flooding
elsewhere, contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), policies
SI12 and SI13 of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1 U of Harrow Core
Strategy (2012) and policies DM9 and DM10 of the Harrow Development Management
Polices Local Plan (2013).</span><span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-bidi-font-family:
&quot;Times New Roman&quot;"><o:p></o:p></span></p>
description: Two storey side extension to create separate semi-detached dwelling; separate amenity space;  bin / cycle store to side (amended)
